meanings.definition: To humble oneself in a demeaning way.
meanings.sent1: She was grovelling before her boss, begging for forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: The servant was grovelling at the feet of the king, asking for mercy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was grovelling for treats, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: His apology was so grovelling, it almost seemed insincere.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the defeated warrior grovelling in defeat was heartbreaking.

meanings.definition: To lie or crawl on the ground in a submissive manner.
meanings.sent1: The thief was grovelling in the dirt, trying to escape capture.
meanings.sent2: The beggar was grovelling outside the palace gates, hoping for alms.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was grovelling on the floor, playing with his toys.
meanings.sent4: The spy was grovelling in the shadows, trying to remain unseen.
meanings.sent5: The injured animal was grovelling in pain, unable to stand up.
